alert.note: Alert for Palm Beach (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 09 at 4:13PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Florida, including the following county, Palm Beach. * WHEN...Until 545 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 413 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... West Palm Beach, Palm Beach, Greenacres, Palm Springs, Haverhill, Cloud Lake, Palm Beach International Airport, Gun Club Estates, Schall Circle, Downtown West Palm Beach, Royal Palm Estates, Lake Belvedere Estates, Golden Lakes, Lake Clarke Shores, Glen Ridge, Westgate-Belvedere Homes, Stacey Street, Century Village, Plantation Mobile Home Park and Cypress Lakes. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
